newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch venture capitalist UPM buys German stake.
newsitem.headline: Dutch venture capitalist UPM buys German stake.

text.p: Unlisted Dutch venture capital firm UPM Groep said on Tuesday it had bought a 25 percent stake in Germany's KMH Group.

KMH is a group of 13 companies which are active in industrial services including renting out building equipment and semi-permanent accommodation. The company, which also has outlets in the Netherlands, has 760 employees and posts a total annual turnover of more than 200 million marks.
UPM said it will support KMH in its international expansion plans and added the German firm is seeking a dominant position in its market segments.
UPM gave no financial details of the KMH stake purchase. The interest was taken by its unit UPM Investments which has total assets of 150 million guilders.

"Given the many interesting opportunities the German market is offering for clustering medium-sized companies, it can be expected that more stakes will be bought (by UPM) there in future," the Dutch venture capital group said in a statement.
UPM is owned by a number of Dutch insurers and large pension funds.
